title: Convicted entrepreneur Elizabeth Holmes must report to prison by May 30
description: A federal appeals court denied the Theranos founder’s request to remain free as she appeals her conviction on wire fraud charges.

title: Fertility app Premom settles with FTC over risky data sharing
description: The settlement with Premom comes in a string of federal actions involving digital health companies, including GoodRX and BetterHelp, which could mark shifting tides for an industry that until now has seen little oversight.

title: ‘Queenmaker’ shows how blogs upended New York’s high society
description: In a new Hulu documentary, director Zackary Drucker explores the rise of blogs about socialites in the 2000s and their lasting effects on internet culture.

title: Epstein-related subpoena for Musk can be served to Tesla, judge rules
description: Attorneys attempted to subpoena Musk in April but were unable to locate him.

title: Philadelphia Inquirer hit by apparent cyberattack amid election coverage
description: The abnormal online activity came days before Philadelphia’s mayoral primary and during a busy stretch of news, causing chaos, staffers said.

title: Uber will let teenagers ride alone, with parental tracking
description: Until now, only people 18 and older were supposed to ride alone in an Uber. Now the company is adding an option for minors older than 13.

title: Musk defends attack on George Soros as Israeli officials flag antisemitism
description: Elon Musk insisted on his right to accuse the Jewish investor George Soros of hating humanity, as the Israeli government reportedly condemned his attacks.

title: This lawmaker stands out for his AI expertise. Can he help Congress?
description: With a graduate degree in computer science, Obernolte has emerged as a leading expert in Congress on how AI works and what lawmakers should worry about.
